A

AbstractStatement - interface flowchart.AbstractStatement.
An instance of interface AbstractStatement is a statement, for example a primitive statement, an IF statement, a WHILE statement, or a sequence of statements.
add(String) - Method in class flowchart.Module
Add a new procedure to this module.
add(AbstractStatement) - Method in class flowchart.Procedure
Add a statement to this procedure.
add(AbstractStatement) - Method in class flowchart.StatementSequence
Add a statement to the sequence.
addCallSite(String, String, String) - Method in class callgraph.CallGraph
Create a new vertex in JGraph for a named call site.
addEdge(String, String) - Method in class callgraph.CallGraph
Create a new directed edge for a procedure call.
addPorts(DefaultGraphCell) - Static method in class flowchart.FlowchartSymbolFactory
Add the default port (center) and other 4 ports (connection points in different directions) to the specified cell.
addProcedure(String, String) - Method in class callgraph.CallGraph
Create a new vertex in JGraph for a named procedure node.

I

IfStatement - class flowchart.IfStatement.
A IF statement consists of a condition (denoted by a diamond) and one or two branches (represented by a StatementSequence respectively).

Constructor of a new IF statement.

M
